Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: mixer-driver
Reviews.Content: Very high price, on line the quote was $60 paid $91.14, small towels, heater took 25 min to warm up,no kleenex, creepy place sort of like Bates Motel in Psycho!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Jmm619
Reviews.Content: We rented the hotel because it was so close to universal studios . The night was very terrible beds were very noisy . The pillows even worse . Hurt your neck.you could even hear people washing there clothes.to top it off my wife forgot her glasses on the bed. I called and told them about them and they did not see anything. And neither did the maid.they were prescription glasses...... Never again!!!!!!!! Had better experience and better service in Mexico

Reviews.Title: “Very Adequate!”
Reviews.Author: higgyhoward
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed here for 3 nights while attending the 2010 Rose Bowl Game. We had plenty of space in our double-queen room with refrigerator & microwave. It was very clean, freshly painted, clean carpeting, NO BUGS, (we pulled the sheets back & checked), thin towels, new sheets & blankets, comfortable mattresses. We all slept well each night. The continental breakfasts were quite adequate consisting of yogurt, sweet rolls, apples, bananas, oranges & good coffee and we all had our fill. All of the staff was quite helpful in giving us directions and tourist tips. They were friendly to us. My mom says "to have friends you must show yourself friendly". It works both ways. I can hardly believe these negative comments I read. I am not sure what people expected from a NOT 5 star establishment, but perhaps they should have gone across the street to the Hilton and paid 4 or 5 times what these rooms cost. For the price, (and for someone who travels all over the world), this place was very adequate with everything we needed. The best part of all, THE LOCATION, with the subway-transit system only a few blocks across the street which very cheaply took us right to the Rose Bowl stadium. It also connected with a line to get one of us to the LAX airport quickly & cheaply. No traffic snarls! I think we got the last parking spot and it was free, so we were thankful & not complaining! We will be driving a subcompact this year so it should fit ok. Two of us plan to stay here again because our beloved Oregon Ducks are in the 2012 Rose Bowl again! We expect everything to be in order and ready for our visit!

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!”
Reviews.Author: Dennis L
Reviews.Content: Our room was very small and the beds were really uncomfortable and noisy. The people of the hotel were really unfriendly and they sometimes treated you like nothing. The breakfast room was the office of the unfriendly host. For breakfast they only had donuts ( which were dry ) and coffee, which was hot water without any taste.

Reviews.Title: “Bugs! poor Maintainance”
Reviews.Author: Nan V
Reviews.Content: Saw bugs every day we were there. Had to put air purifier in room to help out. Coffee and breakfast was cookies most days. Stale donuts on weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Worst night of sleep ever.”
Reviews.Author: Shirley P
Reviews.Content: The place appeared to be very clean. Our room appeared to be built from a carport or other part of building that is also the office. Our beds (2 doubles) at first seemed just noisey, but after tossing and turning several times I realized I was sleeping on box springs, not a mattress. The springs were making noise with each movement, we would have gone to office and checked out however it was 11:45PM and we had been up since 3:45AM. Had planned on awakening at 8AM and instead got up and checked out at 7. When turning in key, I spoke with person on duty, he did interrupt his phone call to see what I wanted, but only said he would inform the management and that he was on a personal call, due to his brothers death. Parking is very difficult, very small lot, only compact cars can park and even that was tight. I could write a book about this experience, but am limited.

Reviews.Title: “Summer Nights”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel back in August of 2011. I stayed for a couple of nights. I've been here a couple of times and I do like this motel because of their location. It all depends what you will be doing. I went to Universal Studios in the morning and then City Walk at night. I had no trouble finding my way, It's about a fifteen minute walk and you can take the tramp at the bottom of the hill to Universal Studios. On the second night i went to Hollywood. I got to say once again the location made it a pleasant experience. The subway is across the street from the Universal Studios tramp and it one stop away from Hollywood. Saved on parking and time. The staff is ok. It's a safe family motel. I enjoyed my visit.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at NiteInn”
Reviews.Author: MickeyHuang
Reviews.Content: Very bad room, not customer friendly, no sleep quality. What a terrible experience!

Reviews.Title: “keep away”
Reviews.Author: maxmax30
Reviews.Content: During checkin the man behind the counter was very busy watching tv and it felt to us that we are disturbing. Breakfast is doughnuts and coffee in the check in office. No seating. No free wifi. 10$/day!!!

Reviews.Title: “Felt safe and close to where I wanted to go”
Reviews.Author: jmayorga
Reviews.Content: The staff was great to me and the kids!! I love that they were soooo close to the shuttles to Universal Studio's!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: ghostly1
Reviews.Content: My son and his gal wanted to go to Halloween Horror Nights at Universal Studios. I decided to drive them down. I picked this hotel which was a good price with close proximity to the park. What a great choice. While the two other hotels are known for their reputation, this little hotel was clean, offered eateries within a few steps and a great price. While its' not the Sheraton, it has clean bedding and a nice staff. There are only two problems and I wouldn't consider them complaints but just one thing that can be worked on and the other can't be just because it can't. The one that can be worked on would be to upgrade their towels. They are older and more than well used (actually one was torn) but they were clean and they were just towels (again, not the Sheraton). The other can't be worked on because at one point this particular issue didn't matter and now that people like me with larger vehicles come in and it's a problem. That would be the parking. A very small amount of parking and mainly for smaller cars. I have a suburban and had the luxury of parking next to a truck that had taken two parking spots and so, I took advantage of that and used just a little of that unusued spot that he had taken up. The problem was in dealing with another "monster" truck who came in late or was visiting and blocked in about four spots in the early morning hours. It wasn't my car blocked but I felt sorry for those that did because I guess they needed to leave and didn't know what to do. In any case, this is a nice little motel that I would visit again. If you can overlook the parking and the worn towels, you have a bargain hotel for a place that is within reasonable walking distance of University Studios.

Reviews.Title: “Lawsuit waiting to happen”
Reviews.Author: dazzll
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because of the location and they had a jetted tub. Parking was terrible had to get up very early to move the car so other quests could get out. The main problem with this place was the beds. Two beds in the room and both had springs sticking out of the side of the mattress I almost cut my leg open on it. They charged a big price for this room which would have been OK if the room was nice. Too bad someone with more insight doesn't redo the rooms. It is old and the so called breakfast was a joke. find another place is my advice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Nickieleigh
Reviews.Content: My son and I relocated to the area and had to find a place to stay while our new place was being finished up to move in. I found the Nite Inn just passing by and decided to stop in and check it out. We have two large dogs so it is sometimes difficult to find a place that will accomodate them. The lady at the front desk was very polite. She was also very helpful during our stay with where things were and recommendations to great places to eat. To the housekeeping staff is wonderful. Checking with us to make sure we did not need anything else and if we did made sure we got it. Not sure about the other reviews on why they were unable to get towels. All in all we had a good experience at the Nite Inn. I have recommended it to my friends that are coming to Universal next month. It in a great location with grocery stores, great restaurants, Universal Studios, Hollywood Bowl, and everything there is to do ove the hill in Hollywood. Very quite and definitely a safe place to stay if you have a child with you.

Reviews.Title: “This is easily the worst place we have ever stayed!!!!”
Reviews.Author: skip1920
Reviews.Content: This place was so gross, dirty and smelly. What they sold us as "adjoining rooms" was a small room with a tiny room off to the side. We had to share a bathroom and the air conditioner didn't work. Beds were like sleeping on boards. We asked for more towels and mgmt told us they were still in the laundry and to come back at 9pm to the office to get them. The ice machine was in the office which was across the parking lot and they had ziplock bags to put the ice in. One of us was stung by something. GROSS!!! Don't stay here..

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place”
Reviews.Author: Click865
Reviews.Content: My nephew and I stayed because it was close to the Rose Bowl. Read the reviews and was expecting the worst. The carpet smell was strong at first but didn't last long. If the previous reiewers would have let the water run for awhile they would have had prenty of hot water. The manager was very helpful with moving cars around the small parking lot. He might have had a scowl but was very friendly once you talked to him. The lady at the desk was very nice and helpful as well. Will stay again when in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Restless Night”
Reviews.Author: Scrapp11
Reviews.Content: We booked this room at this ghetto hotel because it is close by Universal Studios, what a dissappointment when we walked in to a room where you can smell carpet deoderant or some kind of funky aroma. the carpet that looks old and, dirty there was a big spider web on ceiling. Tendant mentioned to my husband when checking in that if we decided to stay another night we would get a $20 discount. During the night we kept getting bit by some type of bug, my husband turns on the light we look on the bed spread and we find fleas, it was [--] gross. We got our money reimbursed, the tendant stated to us that they have never had complaints which is bull [--]!

Reviews.Title: “Had to settle for this place”
Reviews.Author: rikfex
Reviews.Content: My wife and I needed time away from home so we decided to take a spur of the moment weekend down in LA. I grew up there so i am familiar with the area. We settled for this hotel after spending a couple of hours of going around to several hotels in Studio City and in Hollywood. All were either sold out or too expensive for our budget. We came across this hotel as our last one and we were going to take it if it was cheap enough. After talking to the lady at the front desk she told me that he had only 1 room left and it was a smoking room. After getting the approval to stay here from my wife we got the last room. We got our key and went to our room. In order to get to the room you had to unlock a gate that led upstairs where there was only 2 rooms. I like the fact that at least we were secure up there away from everyone else. As we walked in, it didnt smell very much like a smoking room so that was good. The floor was old and dirty and sticky at some points. I never walked on it without shoes on. (my wife laughs at me since I'm extremely spoiled about hotels. Ive spent my entire life staying at Four Seasons hotels. So when i have to stay somewhere that isnt Four Seasons, I'm beyond picky) I checked the bed sheets as soon as i walked in and could tell that they were clean. then i checked the bathroom and that was very clean also. the only think that didnt look very clean was the towels. Luckily I thought about bringing a towel from home. After getting changed, my wife and I went out to dinner. When we came back, parking was a nightmare. Its not the hotels fault as much as it is the people staying there that cant park a car in a space if their life depended on it. We went back out to the room and went to bed. The bed was stiff as a board but we were so tired that we didnt care. The Air conditioner worked great. and the noise from it was like the best white noise machine out there. In there morning at least there was plenty of hot water in the shower. and by their 11 am check out time we were out the driveway. IF and i emphasize on IF we had to stay there again, i would ask for Room 127. Its away from the rest of the people and behind a secure gate.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK”
Reviews.Author: rubbertree
Reviews.Content: The bedroom was small and spartan in its furnishing, but clean sheets and towels were supplied. The walls appeared to have been re-painted recently and there were other signs of recent renovation. However, the carpet that had seen better days was a let-down. A slight musty smell (from the carpet?) that was detected upon entering the room cleared up after running the air-conditioner for a few minutes with the windows open. The few amenities – TV, air-conditioner, hair-dryer and refrigerator – were in good working order. The nicer part of the room was the bathroom which was compactly laid out with a moulded counter-top and shower partition. There was plenty of hot water. A very rudimentary breakfast was thrown in. The main attraction of this hotel is its proximity to Universal Studios. A five minute walk takes you to the shuttle pick-up. Another plus point is the free wireless Internet. Nothing to shout about really, but it’s OK.

Reviews.Title: “Save yourself the money and sleep in your car”
Reviews.Author: rtownkd
Reviews.Content: If you want location this is the one. If you want to sleep comfortable take your ninety dollars elsewere. your better off sleeping in your car than in this filthy, dark, smelly, old hotel. I could handle the lady receptionist being extreamly rude, by not giving us at least one extra pillow, and extra towels. But i could not handle the disgusting rooms. It seems to me that the rooms have a mold problem wich causes the rooms to smell. So instead of fixing the mold they just put drywall mud over it (to make it seem normal) and painted it. The beds smelt like urine, they use the same sheets for every customer because they don't wash the sheets they just make the beds. The towels in the bathrooms had stains (from i don't know what) but that just shows you how clean this place is. The old carpet, was so FILTHY!!!! They don't vaccum and it had lots and lots of stains and iron prints all over. Just to help you compare to a mexican hotel a(im not saying theyre bad). I stayed at one in the middle of nowere for thirty dollars a night that was sooooooo much sanitary, cleaner, and friendlier than this -5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: chriristina
Reviews.Content: When we got there we had asked for a room that was non smoking. Well it stunk so bad like smoke that my son almost had an asthma attack. I went to complain and all they said was it was non smoking and that they could not refund our money. The carpet look like it was drenched in cooking oil. IT WAS SO FILTHY!!!!! The beds were as hard as a rock. The toilet seat had a crack in it. We got blocked in in the parking lot that when we wanted to leave we had to ask for people to move their cars. To top it all off the next morning a lady approached my husband and asked if we had any trouble with bed bugs lasty nite? We told her no. Then she told us that she did!!! YUCK!!!! This was the worst place I have ever stayed at!

Reviews.Title: “left immediately after seeing the room”
Reviews.Author: Travelforfun20
Reviews.Content: Got the place through the SWA website as the closest to Universal Studios. We checked in room 122 and noticed that the very old and dirty carpet has not been even vacuumed (looked like crumbs left over). The towels in the bathrooms had stains, yellow and reddish that seems were left over from the wash. The spredsheet/blanket were smelly. The sheets seemed clean. The mattress did not feel very comfortable either, soft spot in the middle. There was the typical smell of smoke even though the whole place is supposedly non-smoking. The air conditioner was missing the control knob to adjust the temperature. The single-pane window had smelly, old looking drapes, and it looked onto the side of the building where one of the workers just came down the stairs and dumped two black garbage bags. When I opened the window, it was stinking out there. Went out to the front desk and told them about the room condition and asked for a refund. Their answer was "no refunds" We were very disappointed, just left and went elsewhere for the night. From their website it looks like a nice place, don't be fooled. The WORST place I have seen in years of world wide travel

Reviews.Title: “awful”
Reviews.Author: onmartha
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been the most awful i have stayed in my life. I had to ask for money back at 4am. We got up to an inching body at 4am we turn on the light and the bed was infested with bed bug all over about 25 bugs. we pack out thing and left immediately . we had to go the hospital the next day because my husband had a bad reaction to the bites from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy, Dirty, Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: MsKitten
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel after being forced to after driving for hours in the middle of the night looking for a room. The hotel itself is old, decrepit and dirty. The parking lot was tiny and hard to manuver in. The room, which we upgraded to a jacuzzi tub, looked like it hadnt been thoroughly cleaned since the 70's when it was built. The towels were threadbare and stained, the blankets probably hadnt been washed in years were burned and stained as well. I didnt sleep well thinking of all the creepy crawlies that must have been in that room...if you value cleanliness and basic sanitaion dont stay there.

Reviews.Title: “If there was a rating lower than terrible, this place earned it.”
Reviews.Author: jenjaxn
Reviews.Content: Oh. My. Goodness. Unfortunately, we were given one of those horrible rooms up a little rickety staircase on the roof. They were booked that night so we couldn't switch rooms. I don't know what was worse, the room or the exposed wiring wrapped in plastic bags and tape as we walked to our room on the roof. The bed was a full...not queen like we wanted. And we were told there would be internet access and there wasn't. Between the roaches, graffiti on the wallhangings, flooding of the bathroom by the shower, sketchy sheets, dirty carpet, and creepy guys that were hanging around the parking lot looking in the cars...we barely got a wink of sleep. In fact, we drove around looking for another hotel that night but it was too late to get one! The next night, we got a room at the Hilton in downtown LA. I paid 116 dollars (AAA rate) for a room at the Hilton and it was pure luxury. I paid 80 dollars for a room at the Nite Inn and it was a complete ripoff. I will NEVER stay at this place again. It was disgusting.

HotelInfo.Name: Nite Inn at Universal City
HotelInfo.Address: 10612 Ventura Blvd., Studio City, Los Angeles, CA 91604
